alert.note: Alert for Southern Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 09 at 2:08PM PDT until September 09 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: .Gusty winds combined with low humidities will bring critical conditions to portions of fire zones 618, 619, 620 and 280 into this evening. These same areas, except for fire zone 618, will also experience gusty winds and poor overnight recoveries, especially near and at the ridges overnight tonight into Saturday morning. Meanwhile, low humidities and gusty east winds will continue over and near the Southern Oregon Cascades, Siskiyous, and most of the westside, including the coastal mountains, into Saturday evening. Additionally, strong winds and low humidities are likely Saturday afternoon into Saturday evening in the Shasta Valley and the higher terrain in Fire zone 280, including the Mill and Mountain Fires. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST WIND WITH POOR OVERNIGHT RH RECOVERY... * IMPACTS: Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. * AFFECTED AREA: All of Oregon fire zone 618, with the mid slopes and ridges at higher risk. * WIND: East 10 to 20 mph with gusts to around 35 mph. * HUMIDITY: Daytime Humidities 10 to 20 percent. * DETAILED URL: View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens.
